quoteFirst: Harriet Martineau has preserved some of the splendours and "humours" of the coronation with her usual clever power of observation and occasional caustic commentary. "The maids called me at
quoteLast: that June morning, mistaking the clock. I slept no more, and rose at half-past three. As I began to dress the twenty-one guns were fired, which must have awakened all the sleepers in London.
title: Life of Her Most Gracious Majesty the Queen — Volume 1

quoteLast: last night, chartered this car and driver, to be kept waiting for him whenever he called for it.... Coarse work that, for Cousin Arbuthnot--very, very crude....

quoteFirst: At seven the next morning, the first brigade were on the march, accompanied by the second, who followed close in the rear. Taking the Somerset road, we were soon fairly established in all the privileges and comforts of a march on a hot, dry, dusty day. At eleven, A.M., we stopped for dinner, having marched nine miles. We started again at
quoteLast: , P.M., and at four, P.M., encamped near Crab Orchard, twelve miles from our late camp, near Lancaster.
title: My First Campaign
author: Grant, Joseph W.

quoteLast: , full of optimism and cold beef, gaily unconscious that Webster, with measured strides was approaching ever nearer with the note that was to give it him in the neck, proper, Samuel Marlowe dangled his feet from the top bar of the gate at the end of the lane and smoked contentedly as he waited for Billie to make her appearance.
title: Three Men and a Maid
author: Wodehouse, P. G. (Pelham Grenville), 1881-1975

quoteFirst: I was anxious to make an early start, but it was
quoteLast: in the afternoon before I could get my Indians together—Toyatte, a grand old Stickeen nobleman, who was made captain, not only because he owned the canoe, but for his skill in woodcraft and seamanship; Kadachan, the son of a Chilcat chief; John, a Stickeen, who acted as interpreter; and Sitka Charley. quoteFirst: The Lizerne attack had been timed for
quoteLast: All watches had been most carefully synchronized. At 12.15 p.m., to the very second, H Battery fired three shots, then, after an interval, three shots more. Five minutes after the second trio had been sent Hun-ward, I Battery also fired six shots in groups of three.
title:
With Cavalry in 1915
The British Trooper in the Trench Line, Through the Second Battle of Ypres
author: Coleman, Frederic, 1876-1931

quoteFirst: Out of the level, scantily covered with dry brown grass and with a thick growth of leafless trees (small for the most part), rise huge boulders, so piled on one another, with here and there a huge stone so nicely balanced on the top, that one wonders how they ever got there. We are in a populous country, strings of people carrying things on the road. Outspanned at
quoteLast: Here the Dutchman, Smith, had been located, as there is a straw house, and water, the road crossing a spruit. Here, too, is John Lee’s first kraal. People come round the waggon to beg meat.
title: Matabele land and the Victoria Falls
author: Oates, Frank, 1840-1875; Oates, C. G. (Charles George), 1844-1901 [Editor]
